title: Angles in Standard Position - Terminal Ray

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, two different angles <math alttext="alpha"><mi>α</mi></math> and <math alttext="beta"><mi>β</mi></math> are in standard position and share a terminal ray. Based on this information, which of the following gives possible values for <math alttext="alpha"><mi>α</mi></math> and <math alttext="beta"><mi>β</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="alpha equals negative pi over 4"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="beta equals negative fraction numerator 7 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="alpha equals fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 5 end fraction"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="beta equals negative fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 5 end fraction"><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="alpha equals fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="beta equals fraction numerator 8 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="alpha equals fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 6 end fraction"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="beta equals negative pi over 6"><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="alpha equals fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="beta equals fraction numerator 8 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
